name: Asana • simplified and with more hierarchy
description: Goes much further than just changing colors or changing fonts. Generally the goal is to fade back or hide the less important stuff, enlarge the more important stuff. At our shop, we don't use Conversations and barely use Calendar. So those are hidden. We don't often change who's on a team so that's hidden. Etc.
additional_info:
v7 Mar 21 2018
Embed Google fonts; move to Montserrat + Source Code Pro; treat headers for sorted task lists; make tags looks all techy with squarer corners, fixed width, and fixed width font (Source Code Pro); update some elements that Asana updates broke.

v6 Aug 08 2017
Updates to address some apparent under-the-hood changes from Asana.

v5 Jul 24 2017
"Favorites" cleanup: removed the header, the "show recents" expander, and the empty state. Other small cleanup.

v4 Jun 28 2017
Compressed the teams list, updated the site header to not fade away the most important links in Asana – My TASKS and INBOX

v3 June 9 2017
Some fixes to make sure styles also apply in the Inbox.

v2 Jun 8 2017
Tweaks. Fixed sizing of all avatar images to 24px ("small"). Here's a before-after .gif: http://cozy.es/qztvX4

v1 Jun 6 2017
Initial release

Removed everything I could so that I could focus on the parts of Asana we actually use, and with a much stronger information hierarchy. The little "ministories" that show the full history of a task are neat, but really low priority so they're faded way back until you hover on them.

I have no idea what this site is doing to my screenshots. So weird.
